rev.comment: /* Early life */ removed somewhat self-contradicting fringe claims that don't belong in early life, and probably not in the article either
fixed grammar - it should be a not A
gaddafi is not head of state and never has been
rm {{POV|date=March 2011}}; It has been 3 months and I don't see any relevant discussion going on the talk page at the moment.
/* Human rights */ the perspective is not on Human rights in Libya, but on Gaddafi's life - the facts remain, but the info must remain biographical and encycopedic in focus
/* Human rights */ new sources on foreign language education
/* Ideology */ redundant ; not characterized by ideology
Robot - Speedily moving category Muammar al-Gaddafi to [[:Category:Muammar Gaddafi]] per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
wording, e.g., restore nationality, wl [[head of state]]
fixed another mistake - he is the leader and ruler OF libya not "leader and ruler libya"
if some people want to use dictator , am willing to compromise , lets use Leader and Ruler
dictator is such a controversial word lets use Leader
Footnoted some of the clutter at the top
Removed Khamis death "?". All reports of his death are speculation and captured or defected soldiers have confirmed he is leading the battle on the front line.
reverting final pieces of vandalism from now-certified sockpuppet of Sinbad Barron
Removing unscourced and POV claims in the lead.
Was this meant as a joke?

I think we can all do that math, thank you very much.
/* Political repression */ broaden subsection heading; and no, some guy's commentary in [[Forbes]] is not a reliable source on international human rights

/* Personal life and family */ rm subsection: excessive per [[WP:BLP]] and [[WP:PSTS]], and frankly, does the world REALLY need to know if Muammar Gaddafi gobbled down a Whopper whilst a slab of flab was being taken from his tum-tum?!
word choice ("al-Qaid" = "the leader"; "bloodless" abounds in sources) and flow; caps on "West"; combine sentences to avoid dangling paragraph
statement about Jamahiriya contradicts [[Jamahiriya]] article, which does not suggest he personally applied the term
unnecessary, methinks; he is a colonel, so of course he is "commonly referred to" as a colonel, just as Grant is "commonly referred to" as a general

Added text back in regarding "amassing" wealth, in regard to Good faith edit by Cosmic Latte. The phrase is not separate, as you seemed to interpret, but part of the reference regarding nepotism. I added a clarifier to prevent confusion.~~~~
vague and wishy-washy (not to mention POV), e.g., a routine popular election could just as easily (if not even more so) be characterized as a "pro-democracy event"
two changes to sentence: first one for style, second one (boldly) for substance--i.e., "amassing a multi-billion dollar fortune", _per se_, to the Western ear sounds hardly like an accusation
rm duplicate wl (better link to same page in next para)
tweak for grammar (place vs. time) and neutral tone (e.g., BLP)
